City Government
---------------

The City of Taylor has an elected City Council that is comprised of five Council Members, four of whom are elected from single member districts and one Member elected At-Large (see who represents you on the city
[District Map](https://mallard.maps.arcgis.com/apps/instant/lookup/index.html?appid=ce83e323b5be4cc384a093d5ce861a83)
). Council members elect from their number a Mayor and a Mayor Pro Tem.

Taylor is a Home Rule City, which means that the Council can enact legislation, adopt budgets, and determine policies, subject only to limitations imposed by the State Constitution and
the
[City Charter](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/11763/City-Charter-2020-FINAL)
. The City Council is also guided by the
Rules of Decorum
and
Elected Officials Social Media Policy
to ensure their commitment to preserving the integrity of local government.

Presently, the Mayor and Mayor Pro Tem are appointed by the council following each election for a one-year term. In May 2024, voters elected to amend the City Charter to change the at-large council position to Mayor. This change will take effect in May 2026 when the at-large position is up for reelection. Visit the
Election page
for more information regarding the election process.

[Historical list of City Commissioners/Council Members](https://www.taylortx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/10025/Previous-Commissioners-by-date-WEBSITE)

Council meetings are held at 6 p.m. the second and fourth Thursdays of each month at City Hall, 400 Porter Street.

[Click here to visit our video page to watch live or view at a later date](https://www.taylortx.gov/965/Videos)
.

* Special meetings are called as needed and are posted on this website and at City Hall 72 hours prior to the meeting date and time.
* Citizens who wish to address the City Council may do so by filling out a
  Citizens Communication
  form 15 minutes in advance of the meeting at City Council Chambers.

The City Council vision statement is part of the 2020 adopted Strategic Plan to guide City Staff in developing programs and strategies for the good of the community.
To view the Strategic Plan, click here.

, please contact the City of Taylor Communications Department at 512-352-5448 or email: Â communications@taylortx.gov
